Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the number of new cases in the UK by stating "hundreds" when there have only been a dozen confirmed cases.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that British officials have not taken steps towards a full lockdown.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a video with unclear origins and includes conspiracy theories about the virus' origins.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the problematic assumption that the UK is preparing for a full lockdown when there is no evidence to support this.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation that the video clips in the claim may not accurately represent the situation in the UK and could be misleading.
